channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 24th June
item.description:
Rubbish dumped (black bags, bits of wood etc) on little heath by number 64. Been there since last week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Little Heath, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling on pavement, 24th June
item.description:
Dog fouling on pavement by bus stop o/s Sam's Barber shop, This is a busy part of pavement where school children along with pedestrians & passengers awaiting buses. The guilty perpetrators need to educate themselves about cleaning up after their animal fouls.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
This truck has been illegally parked all day on double yellow lines and on the corner. This is illegal and he should be fined

item.title: Overgrown stinging nettles, 24th June
item.description:
In the public footpaths around the river and through the park, the bushes are overgrown but the stinging nettles are worse. The hang into the pathways and it can be impossible to not get stung
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Building waste all over pavement on sidcup high street, 24th June
item.description:
Its been reported that on sidcup high street by Waitrose there has been lots of building materials spilt all over the pavement, this is a trip hazard, please can this be looked into.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup Hill, North Cray, London

item.title: Blocked Drain, 24th June
item.description:
One of the drains in Whitcomb Court is blocked. This is causing a large puddle directly outside of a Prince Of Wales Theatre fire exit, which is used by a large number of people exiting the building at the end of the show each night. The puddle was noticed this afternoon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitcomb Court, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to shed, 24th June
item.description:
The rear apex of the roof of the shed was damaged when the hedges were cut in the park behind our garden. The felt of the roof was ripped and some of the structure was destroyed. It is no longer weather proof. We would like this repaired please. Also the hedge is encroaching on our garden and it needs to be cut back to prevent further damage to our shed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, The Drive, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Part of an old table dumped, 24th June
item.description:
Thu whole area is becoming a dumping ground. The failure to respond to earlier reports is encouraging new flytipping, like this old table left on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Melbourne Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urination in communal areas, 24th June
item.description:
There is a very strong smell of urine in communal areas which needs addressing more frequently as the current cleaning schedule is not resolving the issue. The door maybe unlocked or there maybe tenantsthat are drug users. They need to be evicted as this is creating a health hazard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 154, Plumstead High Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Poplar Grove, Colney Hatch, London

item.title: Black bags of rubbish dumped., 24th June
item.description:
Black bags of rubbish have been dumped on the pathway in the alleyway between Birchdene Drive and Central Way. Been there for about 3 weeks, now bags are ripped open and rubbish is being strewn all over the verge and path. It's making a grubby area look even worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silver Birch Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
